sen.j: 酒船石遺跡（さかふねいしいせき）は、奈良県明日香村岡にある、いくつかの石造物からなる遺跡。
sen.e: The Sakafuneishi Archeological Site is a dig consisting of several pieces of stonework located in Oka, Asuka-mura, Nara Prefecture.
The Sakafuneishi Archeological Site is a dig consisting of several pieces of stonework located in Oka, Asuka-mura, Nara Prefecture.
The Sakafuneishi Archeological Site is a dig consisting of several pieces of stonework located in Oka, Asuka-mura, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 以前から知られている酒船石に加えて、平成12年(2000年)の発掘で発見された亀形石造物と小判形石造物および周辺の遺構を含めて酒船石遺跡と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: In addition to Sakafuneishi which had been known, several pieces of stonework of turtle-shape and coin-shape excavated in 2000 and the other remains found in the surrounding area collectively became known as the Sakafuneishi Archeological Site.

In addition to Sakafuneishi which had been known, several pieces of stonework of turtle-shape and coin-shape excavated in 2000 and the other remains found in the surrounding area collectively became known as the Sakafuneishi Archeological Site.

In addition to Sakafuneishi which had been known, several pieces of stonework of turtle-shape and coin-shape excavated in 2000 and the other remains found in the surrounding area collectively became known as the Sakafuneishi Archeological Site.

sen.j: この命名は明日香村教育委員会によるが、研究者の間では酒船石と亀形石造物との関連性を疑う意見も強く、この名称は適当ではないとの意見も存在する。
sen.e: It was christened by the Asuka Village Board of Education but some researchers have made strong arguments questioning the relationship between Sakafuneishi and those pieces of turtle-shape stonework and some say this name is inappropriate.

It was christened by the Asuka Village Board of Education but some researchers have made strong arguments questioning the relationship between Sakafuneishi and those pieces of turtle-shape stonework and some say this name is inappropriate.

It was christened by the Asuka Village Board of Education but some researchers have made strong arguments questioning the relationship between Sakafuneishi and those pieces of turtle-shape stonework and some say this name is inappropriate.

sen.j: 酒船石
sen.e: Sakafuneishi
Sakafuneishi
Sakafuneishi

sen.j: 小高い丘の上にある花崗岩の石造物。
sen.e: Sakafuneishi is a piece of granite stonework located on the top of a small hill.
Sakafuneishi is a piece of granite stonework located on the top of a small hill.
Sakafuneishi is a piece of granite stonework located on the top of a small hill.

sen.j: 長さ約5.5m、幅約2.3m、厚さ約1mであるが北と南の一部が欠けている。
sen.e: Sakefuneishi is 5.5 meters long, approximately 2.3 meters wide and 1 meter thick with part of the northern and southern sections missing.
Sakefuneishi is 5.5 meters long, approximately 2.3 meters wide and 1 meter thick with part of the northern and southern sections missing.
Sakefuneishi is 5.5 meters long, approximately 2.3 meters wide and 1 meter thick with part of the northern and southern sections missing.

sen.j: 上面に皿状のいくつかのくぼみとそれを結ぶ溝が刻まれている。
sen.e: Carved on the top face are few dish-like indentations that are connected by grooves.
Carved on the top face are few dish-like indentations that are connected by grooves.
Carved on the top face are few dish-like indentations that are connected by grooves.

sen.j: 酒を造る道具、あるいは薬などを造るための道具ともいわれ諸説あるが定かではない。
sen.e: There are various explanations such as that it was a tool for making sake or for making medicine but they remain uncertain.
There are various explanations such as that it was a tool for making sake or for making medicine but they remain uncertain.
There are various explanations such as that it was a tool for making sake or for making medicine but they remain uncertain.

sen.j: 近くに水を引いたと見られる土管や石の樋も見つかっていることから庭園の施設とも言われている。
sen.e: As earthen pipes and stone troughs considered to be used for irrigation were found as well, it is also said that a garden used to exist in this area.
As earthen pipes and stone troughs considered to be used for irrigation were found as well, it is also said that a garden used to exist in this area.
As earthen pipes and stone troughs considered to be used for irrigation were found as well, it is also said that a garden used to exist in this area.

sen.j: 欠けている部分は後に何かに流用したらしく、上面の造形を無視した石割の跡が見られる。
sen.e: It seems that the missing parts were later used for some other purposes and there are visible signs of breaking the stone in a manner which disregarded the form of top surface.
It seems that the missing parts were later used for some other purposes and there are visible signs of breaking the stone in a manner which disregarded the form of top surface.
It seems that the missing parts were later used for some other purposes and there are visible signs of breaking the stone in a manner which disregarded the form of top surface.

sen.j: 欠けた部分には石割用の工具である矢が打ち込まれた跡があり、同じように石を割ろうとした痕跡が鬼の俎にも見ることができる。
sen.e: In the areas that had been chipped away, there are marks made by arrowheads used as a tool to break the stone and, similarly, signs of stone breaking are also visible on Oni-no-Manaita Stone (The Devil's Chopping Board).

In the areas that had been chipped away, there are marks made by arrowheads used as a tool to break the stone and, similarly, signs of stone breaking are also visible on Oni-no-Manaita Stone (The Devil's Chopping Board).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。
sen.e: In the areas that had been chipped away, there are marks made by arrowheads used as a tool to break the stone and, similarly, signs of stone breaking are also visible on Oni-no-Manaita Stone (The Devil's Chopping Board).

sen.j: 高取城を築く際に、石垣用の石材として利用しようとしたためとみられる。
sen.e: It seems that part of Sakefuneishi was chipped away to use for building stone walls when Takatori-jo Castle was being constructed.
It seems that part of Sakefuneishi was chipped away to use for building stone walls when Takatori-jo Castle was being constructed.
It seems that part of Sakefuneishi was chipped away to use for building stone walls when Takatori-jo Castle was being constructed.

sen.j: 亀形、小判形石造物、他
sen.e: Turtle-Shape and Coin-Shape Stonework and Other Items
Turtle-Shape and Coin-Shape Stonework and Other Items
Turtle-Shape and Coin-Shape Stonework and Other Items

sen.j: 平成4年（1992年）に酒船石の北の斜面で石垣が発見され、日本書紀の斉明天皇の時代に記述される工事に該当する遺跡と推測されている。
sen.e: In 1992, stone walls were found on the north slope of Sakefuneishi that are presumed to be the remains corresponding to the construction which was mentioned in Nihonshoki (the Chronicles of Japan) during the era of Emperor Saimei.

In 1992, stone walls were found on the north slope of Sakefuneishi that are presumed to be the remains corresponding to the construction which was mentioned in Nihonshoki (the Chronicles of Japan) during the era of Emperor Saimei.

In 1992, stone walls were found on the north slope of Sakefuneishi that are presumed to be the remains corresponding to the construction which was mentioned in Nihonshoki (the Chronicles of Japan) during the era of Emperor Saimei.

sen.j: 記述中の「宮の東の山に石を累ねて垣とす。」の「宮」が酒船石の南西にある飛鳥京跡であり「東の山」が酒船石のある丘ということである。
sen.e: 'The palace' in the sentence which read, 'Walls were built by piling stones on the mountain to the east of the palace,' mentioned in Nihonshoki means the ruins of Asukakyo and 'the mountain to the east (of the palace)' is the hill on which Sakefuneishi is located.
sen.cmt: この文章は書き換えないと英文に訳して意味が通じなくなりますので、別々に分けてあったものを1個にまとめてあります。
sen.e: 'The palace' in the sentence which read, 'Walls were built by piling stones on the mountain to the east of the palace,' mentioned in Nihonshoki means the ruins of Asukakyo and 'the mountain to the east (of the palace)' is the hill on which Sakefuneishi is located.
sen.cmt: 全角の'を半角にしました。
sen.e: 'The palace' in the sentence which read, 'Walls were built by piling stones on the mountain to the east of the palace,' mentioned in Nihonshoki means the ruins of Asukakyo and 'the mountain to the east (of the palace)' is the hill on which Sakefuneishi is located.

sen.j: その後平成12年（2000年）に大規模な発掘が行われ、砂岩でできた湧水設備とそれに続く形で小判形石造物と亀形石造物が発見された。
sen.e: In 2000, a large-scale excavation was subsequently performed and a sump water system made by gravel stones and the pieces of coin-shape and turtle-shape stonework were found one after the other.
In 2000, a large-scale excavation was subsequently performed and a sump water system made by gravel stones and the pieces of coin-shape and turtle-shape stonework were found one after the other.
In 2000, a large-scale excavation was subsequently performed and a sump water system made by gravel stones and the pieces of coin-shape and turtle-shape stonework were found one after the other.

sen.j: これら二つは水槽になっており水を溜めたと推定される。
sen.e: It is assumed that these two pieces of stonework were used as tanks to collect water.
It is assumed that these two pieces of stonework were used as tanks to collect water.
It is assumed that these two pieces of stonework were used as tanks to collect water.

sen.j: さらにそれに続いて石を並べた溝や石段があり、全体を囲むように石垣や石敷がある。
sen.e: Additionally, next to those two pieces of stonework are gutters lined with stones and stone steps with stone walls and stone paving surrounding all of them.
Additionally, next to those two pieces of stonework are gutters lined with stones and stone steps with stone walls and stone paving surrounding all of them.
Additionally, next to those two pieces of stonework are gutters lined with stones and stone steps with stone walls and stone paving surrounding all of them.

sen.j: 亀形石造物は花崗岩で作られており全長約2.4m、幅約2mで頭や尻尾、足が造形されている。
sen.e: The turtle shape stonework is made of granite measuring 2.4 meters long and 2 meters wide which was carved to form the shape of head, tail and legs of a turtle.
The turtle shape stonework is made of granite measuring 2.4 meters long and 2 meters wide which was carved to form the shape of head, tail and legs of a turtle.
The turtle shape stonework is made of granite measuring 2.4 meters long and 2 meters wide which was carved to form the shape of head, tail and legs of a turtle.

sen.j: 甲羅部分が直径1.25m、深さ20cmでくりぬかれ鉢状になっている。
sen.e: The part of the carapace measuring 1.25 meter in diameter and 20 cm in depth was hollowed out to form a basin.
The part of the carapace measuring 1.25 meter in diameter and 20 cm in depth was hollowed out to form a basin.
The part of the carapace measuring 1.25 meter in diameter and 20 cm in depth was hollowed out to form a basin.

sen.j: 頭の部分の穴から水が流れ込み尻尾の穴から流れ出したと見られる。
sen.e: It seems that water entered through the hole in the turtle head and exited from another hole in the tail.
It seems that water entered through the hole in the turtle head and exited from another hole in the tail.
It seems that water entered through the hole in the turtle head and exited from another hole in the tail.

sen.j: 尻尾に栓をすることで水を溜めることもできる。
sen.e: Water could be pooled by plugging the tail.
Water could be pooled by plugging the tail.
Water could be pooled by plugging the tail.

sen.j: 小判形石造物は長さ1.65m、幅1mで深さ20cmで同じく水が貯められるようになっており排水口は、亀の頭に繋がっている。
sen.e: The coin shape stonework measuring 1.65 meters long, 1 meter wide and 20 centimeters deep could also be used to pool water with its drain being connected to the turtle head.
The coin shape stonework measuring 1.65 meters long, 1 meter wide and 20 centimeters deep could also be used to pool water with its drain being connected to the turtle head.
The coin shape stonework measuring 1.65 meters long, 1 meter wide and 20 centimeters deep could also be used to pool water with its drain being connected to the turtle head.

sen.j: 斉明期に最初に造られその後平安時代まで約250年間使用された形跡がある。
sen.e: Evidence shows that these pieces of stonework were originally created during the era of Emperor Saimei and was in use until the Heian Period for approximately 250 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Evidence shows that these pieces of stonework were originally created during the era of Emperor Saimei and was in use until the Heian period for approximately 250 years.
Evidence shows that these pieces of stonework were originally created during the era of Emperor Saimei and was in use until the Heian period for approximately 250 years.

sen.j: なんらかの祭祀が行われた遺構と推定されるが定かではない。
sen.e: It is assumed that they are the remains of the ritual site where some kind of religious service was performed but it has yet to be substantiated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is assumed that they are the remains of the ritual site where some kind of religious service was performed but it has yet to be substantiated.
It is assumed that they are the remains of the ritual site where some kind of religious service was performed but it has yet to be substantiated.

sen.j: 斉明天皇の両槻宮（ふたつきのみや）の関連施設ではとの説もある。
sen.e: There is also an opinion that it may have been the structure related to Futatsuki no Miya (Futatsuki Palace) of Emperor Saimei.
There is also an opinion that it may have been the structure related to Futatsuki no Miya (Futatsuki Palace) of Emperor Saimei.
There is also an opinion that it may have been the structure related to Futatsuki no Miya (Futatsuki Palace) of Emperor Saimei.

sen.j: 酒船石のほぼ真北に位置するが両者の関連も明らかではない。
sen.e: The turtle shape and coin shape stonework are situated virtually at true north of Sakefuneishi but the relationship between these two remains unknown.
The turtle shape and coin shape stonework are situated virtually at true north of Sakefuneishi but the relationship between these two remains unknown.
The turtle shape and coin shape stonework are situated virtually at true north of Sakefuneishi but the relationship between these two remains unknown.

sen.j: なお、この部分は発掘後、大規模な一般見学会が行われた。
sen.e: After this section was found, grand-scale public tours were offered.
After this section was found, grand-scale public tours were offered.
After this section was found, grand-scale public tours were offered.

sen.j: 現在見学は文化財保存協力金という名目で有料となっている。
sen.e: At present, there is a charge for the tour of the turtle shape and coin shape stonework under the pretext of donation for cultural property conservation.
At present, there is a charge for the tour of the turtle shape and coin shape stonework under the pretext of donation for cultural property conservation.
At present, there is a charge for the tour of the turtle shape and coin shape stonework under the pretext of donation for cultural property conservation.

sen.j: 酒船石は従来通り自由に見ることができる。
sen.e: Sakefuneishi can be viewed at free of charge as in the past.
Sakefuneishi can be viewed at free of charge as in the past.
Sakefuneishi can be viewed at free of charge as in the past.

sen.j: 出水酒船石
sen.e: Demizu-no-Sakafune-ishi Sculptured Stone
Demizu no Sakafune ishi Sculptured Stone
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: Demizu no Sakafune ishi Sculptured Stone

sen.j: 酒船石遺跡には含まれないが、約400m離れた飛鳥川畔で2個の石造物が見つかっており、これも水を流したような溝などがあり同じく酒船石と名付けられている。
sen.e: While not included in the Sakefuneishi Archeological Site, 2 pieces of stonework were found on the banks of Asuka-gawa River approximately 400 meters away bearing grooves that seem to have been used to run water in whereby they are named Sakefuneishi as well.

While not included in the Sakefuneishi Archeological Site, 2 pieces of stonework were found on the banks of Asuka-gawa River approximately 400 meters away bearing grooves that seem to have been used to run water in whereby they are named Sakefuneishi as well.

While not included in the Sakefuneishi Archeological Site, 2 pieces of stonework were found on the banks of Asuka-gawa River approximately 400 meters away bearing grooves that seem to have been used to run water in whereby they are named Sakefuneishi as well.

sen.j: 区別するためこちらを出水の酒船石、もう一方を岡の酒船石と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: To distinguish, one may be referred to as Sakefuneishi of Demizu while the other Sakefuneishi of Oka.
To distinguish, one may be referred to as Sakefuneishi of Demizu while the other Sakefuneishi of Oka.
To distinguish, one may be referred to as Sakefuneishi of Demizu while the other Sakefuneishi of Oka.

sen.j: 現物は京都市に移動されており見ることはできないがレプリカが奈良文化財研究所公開施設にある。
sen.e: Having been relocated to Kyoto City, the original pieces of stonework are no longer available for viewing but there are replicas on display in the exhibit area at the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties.

Having been relocated to Kyoto City, the original pieces of stonework are no longer available for viewing but there are replicas on display in the exhibit area at the Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties.
